Docs.remarks: This field is optional and has the default value of true.

Docs.summary: If a is an item definition metadata or item metadata, this field specified the item type of the item definition or the item, respectively. For common properties this field must not be set.
Docs.value: The item type of the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.XamlTypes.BaseProperty> is an item definition metadata or item metadata, this field specifies the item type of the item definition or the item, respectively. For common properties, this field must not be set.

Docs.summary: The label of the MSBuild property group/item definition group to which a property/item definition metadata belongs to. Default value is the empty string.
Docs.value: The label of the property or item group.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value is the empty string.

Docs.example: A VC++ property that exists in the project manifest in the MSBuild property group with label Globals would have this same value for this field.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the actual MSBuild property name used to read/write the value of this property. Applicable only to objects attached to properties.
Docs.value: The MSBuild property name to use; or null to use the as the MSBuild property name.

remarks.para: The persisted name will usually be the same as the property name as it appears in the and the value of this property can therefore be left at is default of null. Since property names must be unique but need not be unique in the persisted store (due to other differences in the data source such as item type) there may be times when Rule property names must be changed to be unique in the XAML file, but without changing how the property is persisted in the MSBuild file. It is in those cases where this property becomes useful.
It may also be useful in specialized build environments where property names must differ from the normally used name in order to maintain compatibility with the project system.

Docs.summary: The storage location for this data source.
Docs.value: The storage location for this data source.
Docs.remarks: This field is mandatory unless is set. In that case, the parent will be used with the specified style. Example values are ProjectFile and UserFile. ProjectFile causes the property value to be written to and read from the project manifest file or the property sheet (depending on which node in the solution explorer/property manager window is used to spawn the property pages UI). UserFile causes the property value to be written to and read from the .user file.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PersistenceStyle { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.PersistenceStyle : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The storage style for this data source.
Docs.remarks: For example, with of ProjectFile, this field can be Element (default) to save as a child XML Element, or Attribute to save properties as an XML attribute.

Docs.summary: The data type of the source. Generally one of Item, ItemDefinition, Property, or TargetResults (when is non-empty). Among other things this governs how the data is treated during build.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically has the value `Item`, `ItemDefinition`, or `Property`.

Docs.example: A value of Item for this property indicates that this property is actually an item array - the list of all items with the item type specified by .
